page.title: 07ECOLOGY,VEGETATION
page.content: The whole area is either grassland or moorland. The lower fields may be classed as intensively managed, being pastures which are used for the production of hay or silage during summer to be fed to the stock during winter and early spring.These pastures are occasionally ploughed and seeded in order to improve the quality of the grass. Along the valley sides there are occasional patches of scrub or relict woodland. These are mainly deciduous, comprising oak,beech,birch, chestnut and rowan according to expos- ure to the wind and the extent to which sheep graze there during winter and spring. Fforest Fach itself is an interesting mixture of short-cropped bilberry and grass, with large invasive patches of bracken.
